intro: Sessea suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-smelling sessea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in yellow or greenish-white. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
